job_title: Vice President, Informatica Developer/ Administrator II
location: New York, New York, United States
description:
At BNY, our culture empowers you to grow and succeed. As a leading global financial services company at the center of the world’s financial system we touch nearly 20% of the world’s investible assets. Every day around the globe, our 50,000+ employees bring the power of their perspective to the table to create solutions with our clients that benefit businesses, communities and people everywhere.

We continue to be a leader in the industry, awarded as a top home for innovators and for creating an inclusive workplace. Through our unique ideas and talents, together we help make money work for the world. This is what is all about.

We’re seeking a future team member in the role of Vice President, Informatica Developer/ Administrator II to join our Structured Debt Client Platform Engineering team. This role is in New York, NY- ONSITE/HYBRID (4-day in office/1 day optional remote).

We are seeking a highly skilled ETL/Informatica developer with expertise in both development and administration of Informatica/ ETL technologies to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of experience in Informatica ETL development and administration including installation, configuration, support, and ETL workflow development. A degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred.

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways: 

Perform installation, configuration, and support of Informatica ETL tools.
Develop and manage ETL workflows.
Expose workflows as web services using Web Service Hub (WSH).
Integrate Mainframe VSAM and DB2 with Informatica workflows.
Manage database integration with Oracle, Mainframe, and Salesforce.
Write complex SQL queries using advanced SQL functions.
Debug and troubleshoot ETL processes.
Understand and translate business/functional requirements into technical designs.
Collaborate with a large team and lead database efforts.
Document customer requirements and explain technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Adjust to changing priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry best practices, bringing new ideas and innovative approaches to the testing process.
Effectively communicate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and other stakeholders, to ensure a shared understanding of testing requirements.

To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following: 

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
7-9 years of experience with Inforamtica ETL Administration activities
Well versed with Web Service Hub (WSH) exposing the workflows as web services
Well versed with Power Center/Power Exchange
Well versed with Mainframe VSAM and DB2 integration with Informatica workflows
Well versed with database concepts and integration with Oracle, Mainframe and salesforce
Well versed with writing complex SQL queries by using advanced SQL functions
Good debugging skills
Good experience in understanding the business/functional requirements
Experience with AWS Glue is a PLUS
Knowledge of Mortgage security (MBS) preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

At BNY, our culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:

America’s Most Innovative Companies, Fortune, 2024
World’s Most Admired Companies, Fortune 2024
Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Corporate Equality Index, 100% score, 2023-2024 Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion, Disability: IN – 100% score, 2023-2024
“Most Just Companies”, Just Capital and CNBC, 2024
Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, Top performing company for Sustainability, 2024
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI), 2023

Our Benefits And Rewards

BNY offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves, including paid volunteer time, that can support you and your family through moments that matter.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

BNY assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $95,000 and $203,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNY total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.

This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

ONLY CANDIDATES LOCAL TO AUSTIN TEXAS NEED APPLY, ONSITE 2 days a week ******

Overview:

Understands business objectives and problems, identifies alternative solutions, performs studies and cost/benefit analysis of alternatives. Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate processing or to improve existing computer system: Confers with personnel of organizational units involved to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, and learn specific input and output requirements, such as forms of data input, how data is to be; summarized, and formats for reports. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer program. Reviews computer system capabilities, specifications, and scheduling limitations to determine if requested program or program change is possible within existing system.

HHSC IT is continuing to develop an HHS data integration hub with a goal to accomplish the following:

Implementation and configuration of the infrastructure for the data integration hub
Design, development, and implementation (DD&I) of the data integration hub using an agile methodology for all standard SDLC phases that includes, but is not limited to: 
Validation of performance metric requirements
Creation of Epics/User Stories/Tasks
Automation of data acquisition from a variety of data sources
Development of complex SQL scripts 
Testing integration, load and stress
Deployment / publication internally and externally
Operations support and enhancement of the data integration hub
This development effort will utilize an agile methodology based upon the approach currently in use at HHSC for the Texas Integrated Eligibility Redesign System (TIERS). As a member of the agile development team, the worker responsibilities may include:
Data acquisition from a variety of data sources for multiple uses.
Developing complex SQL scripts to transform the source data to fit into a dimensional model, then to create views and materialized views in Oracle.
Developing automation with Informatica IICS or Power Center to pull data from external data sources and transform it to fit into a dimensional model.
Collaborating with other members of the Data Engineering Team on the design and implementation of an optimal data design.
Verification and validation of SQL scripts, Informatica automation and database views.
Developing automated means of performing verification and validation.
Participating in all sprint ceremonies
Work closely with the Architects and Data Engineering Team on implementation designs and data acquisition strategies.
Enhance and maintain the Java web site that provides Tableau dashboards to an array of users with different roles.
Develop mockups and work with customers for validation
Working closely with other members of the team to address technical problems 
Assisting with the implementation and configuration of developmental tools
Producing and maintaining technical specifications, diagrams, or other documentation as needed to support the DD&I efforts 
Participation in requirements and design sessions 
Interpreting new and changing business requirements to determine the impact and proposing enhancements and changes to meet these new requirements

About The Role

As a Data Engineer – AWS and Informatica, you will make an impact by designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines and systems. You will be a valued member of the cloud modernization and migration team and work collaboratively with modern data engineering experts.

In This Role, You Will

Monitor the system’s performance and conduct database tuning.
Plan and execute migration projects.
Craft complex SQL queries and optimize them. Ability to tweak query performance and optimize database operations.
Use cloud platforms for hosting databases and performing migrations such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud.

Work Model

At Cognizant, we strive to provide flexibility wherever possible, and we are here to support a healthy work-life balance though our various wellbeing programs. Based on this role’s business requirements, this is an onsite position requiring 5 days a week in a client or Cognizant office in McLean, VA.

The working arrangements for this role are accurate as of the date of posting. This may change based on the project you’re engaged in, as well as business and client requirements. Rest assured; we will always be clear about role expectations.

What You Need To Have To Be Considered

Expertise in Informatica IICS, AWS Database Migration Service (DMS).
Strong understanding of Extract Transform Load (ETL) processes and tools.
Experience with different database management systems such as PostgreSQL Db2 and Oracle.
Awareness of data security best practices and compliance requirements.
Proficiency in Java and frameworks like Spring Boot.
Familiarity with tools and techniques for data validation and cleansing. 

These Will Help You Stand Out

Experience with Java Persistence API (JPA) and Hibernate for ORM.
Experience with testing frameworks like JUnit.
Familiarity with BDD tools such as Cucumber for testing.
Excellent communication skills for collaborating with stakeholders.
Experience with scripting languages like Python or Shell scripting for automation tasks. 

We're excited to meet people who share our mission and can make an impact in a variety of ways. Don't hesitate to apply, even if you only meet the minimum requirements listed. Think about your transferable experiences and unique skills that make you stand out as someone who can bring new and exciting things to this role.

Salary And Other Compensation

Applications will be accepted until July 20, 2025

The annual salary for this position is between $ 90,000 - $ 109,000 depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.

Benefits: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off
401(k) plan and contributions
Long-term/Short-term Disability
Paid Parental Leave
Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.

job_title: Sr. Informatica Developer with AWS Cloud
description:
Greetings from Sligo Software Solutions, Inc. !!

This is Dasharatham from SLIGO. We have an urgent requirement for Sr. Informatica Developer with AWS Cloud position with our client.

Title : Sr. Informatica Developer with AWS Cloud

Location : Menands, New York

Duration : 12 Months

Client : NY State - Office of Mental Health

Job ID: SLG - 19 - 10828

Respond by: 07/10/25 5:00 PM

Description

RFMH/NYSOMH projects including Crisis Response and Coordination Systems used in NYS to support crisis coordination, referrals, clinical information sharing, and monitoring.

Duties 

Working on Informatica Power Center tool (On premise or Cloud) – Source Analyzer, Data warehousing designer, Mapping & Mapplet Designer, and Transformation Designer.
Extracting data from Cloud system to the Staging Area and loaded the data to the target database by ETL process using Informatica Power Center.
Perform the performance and tuning at source and target levels using Indexes, Hints and Partitioning in, ORACLE and Informatica.
Convert the PL/SQL Procedures to Informatica mappings and at the same time created procedures in the database level for optimum performance of the mappings.
Senior ETL Developer is primarily responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of ETL development to support the needs of data warehousing.
Working with AWS, Kafka, using DMS tools to process data for different sources and targets
Working Experience with ER Studio/Erwin or other Data Modeling tools. Experience with Star Schema or Snowflake data models.
Working with UNIX shell scripts for automation of jobs.
Investigate and fix the bugs occurred in the production environment and providing the on-call support.
Perform Unit testing and maintained test logs and test cases for all the mappings.
Maintain warehouse metadata, naming standards and warehouse standards for future application development.
Parsing high-level design specification to simple ETL coding along with mapping standards.
Day to day batch jobs monitoring and troubleshooting.
Loading and transforming data from various heterogenous sources.
Postgres CRUD operations.
Monitor the performance of the database and ensure optimum performance.
Identify potential issues in the database to solve them early.
Maintain backups and perform disaster recovery.
Learn new technology and implement products as the business demands
Collaborate with teams across the organization
Participate to own and maintain new and existing project modules.
Participate in all SCRUM ceremonies

Mandatory Requirements

Experience (14+ Years)

Requirements

This is an 100% Onsite
5 – 10 years of experience in ETL development with a strong focus on Informatica Power Center (both on-premises and cloud-based) environments.
Extensive hands-on experience with Informatica Power Center tools, including, source Analyzer
Experience extracting data from various sources, including cloud systems.
Experience with Data Warehousing Designer: Designing schemas and data warehouses. Mapping & Mapplet Designer: Creating and managing data transformations. Transformation Designer: Designing complex transformations and data flows.
Proven expertise in ETL processes, including extracting data from cloud systems, moving it to staging areas, and loading it into target databases.
Proficiency in performance tuning and optimization techniques, such as using indexes, hints, and partitioning in databases like Oracle, Postgres, and Informatica.
Hands-on experience in debugging and troubleshooting production issues, providing on-call support, and ensuring smooth production environments.
Experience with unit testing of ETL mappings, including maintaining detailed test logs and test cases to ensure data quality.
Knowledge of metadata management, maintaining naming standards, and ensuring warehouse standards are met for future application development and data management.
Experience with AWS, Kafka and DMS tools
Experience parsing high-level design specifications into detailed ETL coding with adherence to mapping standards.
Strong proficiency in database technologies, including Oracle, and cloud-based databases with the ability to integrate complex ETL workflows.
Excellent understanding of data warehousing concepts, data integration, and data modeling to support robust and scalable ETL solutions.
Strong experience in Informatica performance tuning to ensure optimal ETL execution and data flow processes.
Experience with data warehousing in large-scale environments with distributed databases.
Experience with real-time ETL solutions and data streaming.
Experience with AWS Postgres DBA tasks
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and ability to work in fast-paced, iterative development cycles.
Knowledge of data governance and ensuring data compliance with standards and regulations.
Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts and architects.
Health care industry experience is a plus.

Thank you,

Katta Dasharatham

Recruiting Team Lead

Sligo Software Solutions Inc.

dasharatham.katta@sligosoft.com

www.sligosoft.com

Direct: (518) 818-6239

Office: (518) 444 0459 x 116

Fax : (518) 444 0457

https://www.linkedin.com/in/dasharatham/

Due to my back-to-back calls, there are times when I might miss your calls. Email is the best way to reach me**

Technology Stack & Key Skills: 

- IICS Expertise: Extensive experience in IICS, including Cloud Data Integration, Data Quality, Application Integration, and Mass Ingestion for cloud-based ETL solutions. 
- ETL & Data Workflows: Proficient in designing and implementing ETL pipelines, data workflows, and transformations using IICS and SQL. 
- Cloud Platform: Strong SQL proficiency with BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform. 
- API Integration: Expertise in integrating external systems using REST APIs and custom connectors within IICS. 
- Tools & Platforms: Familiarity with GitHub, Atlassian (Jira / Confluence), and ServiceNow. 
- SQL Expertise: Ability to craft complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and optimization. 
- Cloud Architecture: Comprehensive understanding of cloud data architecture, data modeling, and data warehousing principles. 
- Team Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor teams while managing project timelines and deliverables. 
- Performance Optimization: Skilled in enhancing IICS processes for improved performance, scalability, and reliability. 
- Client Collaboration: Strong capability in requirement gathering, offering technical guidance, and presenting solutions to stakeholders. 
- Problem-Solving: Adept at diagnosing and resolving data workflow issues to ensure accuracy and high availability.

Technology stack:
1. Informatica – Cloud (IICS) 
2. BigQuery & Google Cloud Platform – Strong SQL proficiency 
3. Fabric/Power BI 
4. GitHub 
5. Atlassian (Jira / Confluence) 
6. ServiceNow

*Role: Informatica MDM & ETL Lead*

*Location: Wilmington, DE – Onsite*

*Type: Contract*

1. Informatica Master Data Management (MDM) applications based on identified architecture and support implementation of design by resolving complex technical issues faced by the IT project team during development, deployment, and support.

2. Provide production system operations and maintenance (O&M) support for end-users, applications, infrastructure, or network services. Troubleshoot existing information systems, application, middleware, or networks to identify errors or deficiencies.

3. Make recommendations and influence long-term technology strategy and planning for multiple business units.

4. Assist in the development and analysis of source selection strategies. Serve as a consultant and escalation point for issues.

5. Provide technical analyses to help define, assess, and monitor the technical aspects of the program/project or service.

6. Design innovative solutions using new technologies. 

7. Recommend short-term alternatives when appropriate.

8. Work with vendors during the problem-resolution process as needed. Provides technical expertise across business functions. Identify opportunities to improve business processes via new technologies.



*Technical/Functional Skills:*

* Informatica MDM Development

* Architecting MDM Solutions

* PL/SQL

* Postgres SQL, Red shift and DynamoDB

* AppDynamics and Kibana

* Oracle DB

* MDM HUB & SIF

* Tools, Utilities &Methodology:

* Service Now and Control-M. Service Oriented Modeling and Architecture, AGILE, Waterfall, Iterative, Object Oriented Analysis and Design



*Roles & Responsibilities :*

* To uniquely identify master data and its relationships across distributed data sources and deliver unified views of Member, Provider, Reference Data while dynamically synchronizing master data changes throughout the enterprise.

* To mitigate the risk of data corruption across different interfaces by implementing one master data source, thus maintaining data consistency

* Provides support Middleware team on the installations, code deployments, any configurations, any updates/patches that are needed, as well as any start/stops that are required on Stage and Production. In other words, any change needed for the infrastructure or code, the Middleware team will do.

* Need to understand generic wrapper to call the existing oracle user exists by new java APIs( Java SIF).

* To support real time integration custom java application. Execute the upgrades for Hub Server, Cleanse Server, Master ORS, CMX ORS and JRE and Implement Business Entity using Provisioning Tool.

* Writing complex SQL queries on Databases.

* Hands on experience on Match & Merge, Hub Store, Metadata Manager, SAM, Batch Viewer, Cleansing, Load & Publish process.

* To interact with the customer in real time providing the best of data there by gaining best customer experience

* Support Informatica MDM Batch Jobs: Ensure smooth operation of batch jobs in the production environment.

* Enhancements: Implement minor enhancements to improve system functionality and bug fixes.

* Tokenization Process: Monitor and support the tokenization process.

* Data Management: Oversee the match and merge process for customer data. Identify old data and perform hard deletion of data using SIF mechanism

* Health Checks: Perform daily health & daily status checks on batch outputs and updates to business stakeholders.

* Understand Support applications on AWS Services, AWS Lambda or other AWS native orchestration tooling and maintaining DynamoDB, Lambda, and SNS services in AWS.

* Deep understanding on application and log level monitoring tools like AppDynamics ,Grafana and EFK( Kibana)

* ITIL Process( Incident, Change, Problem & Release management) .

Job Description

Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Informatica IICS Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS), with a strong background in Java, data integration, and messaging services. Familiarity with Kafka and Apache Spark is highly desirable. This role involves designing, developing, and implementing data integration solutions to support our business operations and analytics.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement data integration workflows and processes using Informatica IICS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements for data integration and transformation.
Develop and maintain integrations between various systems using messaging services such as Kafka.
Write and optimize Java code to support custom data integration and transformation needs.
Work with large-scale data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark to enable efficient data handling.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and consistency across systems and processes.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data integration workflows to ensure high performance and reliability.
Maintain proper documentation of data integration processes, workflows, and technical specifications.
Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in data integration, messaging services, and cloud technologies.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS), including Data Integration and Application Integration.
Proficiency in Java programming for data transformation and integration tasks.
Strong understanding of data integration concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data mapping.
Experience with messaging services such as Apache Kafka for real-time data streaming and integration.
Knowledge of Apache Spark for distributed data processing and analytics.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform) and their data services is a plus.
Solid understanding of relational databases, SQL, and NoSQL databases.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot data-related issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with API development and integration using REST or SOAP.
Knowledge of DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines for data integration workflows.
Familiarity with data governance and data security best practices.
Certification in Informatica IICS or related technologies is a plus.

description:
Job Title: Informatica ETL Developer – Data Integration & Automation
Location: Hybrid - Austin, TX

Position will be 3 days remote with 2 day (Mondays and Wednesdays) required to be onsite.

Job Overview: We are looking for a highly skilled Informatica ETL Developer to join our data engineering team in building and enhancing a large-scale Data Integration Hub supporting enterprise analytics and reporting. You’ll design, develop, and automate ETL workflows using Informatica IICS / PowerCenter / IDMC, build complex SQL transformations, and automate data validations using Python.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and automate ETL mappings/workflows using Informatica IICS, PowerCenter, or IDMC
Perform data acquisition and integration from varied sources (Oracle, SQL Server, Snowflake, Excel, PDF)
Design and implement complex SQL queries and scripts for transformation and performance tuning
Write Python scripts for automated data validation and QA testing
Support and optimize dimensional data models and Oracle-based materialized views
Collaborate with architects, analysts, and QA to meet evolving data needs
Participate in Agile ceremonies, sprint planning, and user story grooming
Maintain documentation: technical specs, mappings, data flow diagrams

Required Skills (Must Have):
8 years – Experience developing mappings and workflows to automate ETL processes using Informatica IICS, IDMC, or PowerCenter
8 years – Experience acquiring and integrating data from multiple data sources/technologies (e.g., Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server, Excel, Access, Adobe PDF) using Informatica for Tableau dashboards
8 years – Experience designing and developing complex SQL scripts that are fast and efficient
8 years – Experience as a Data Analyst on analytics, performance management, or data warehousing projects
8 years – Experience with technical writing and diagramming using tools like Visio, Erwin, and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and MS Project
8 years – Experience developing Python scripts for data testing and automation
8 years – Experience identifying, recording, and tracking defects across the development lifecycle
8 years – Experience collaborating with development teams to improve quality processes
8 years – Experience developing test plans, test cases, and test scripts
8 years – Ability to identify and communicate business risks related to testing and implementation
8 years – Strong self-motivation, time-management, and problem-solving skills
8 years – Ability to work independently and in a team
8 years – Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail
8 years – Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly

Preferred Skills (Nice to Have):
4 years – Experience enhancing or building automated regression and functional test suites, preferably AI-enhanced
2 years – Experience working with or validating AI-integrated products
2 years – Experience with observability and testing infrastructure at scale
2 years – Proven track record of innovation in software quality or test automation

job_title: ETL Analyst/Engineer (Informatica & SQL Specialist) - W2 Candidates Only
description:
About the Role
Are you an experienced ETL professional ready to make an impact on large-scale data modernization initiatives? A State of Texas agency, in partnership with the Department of Information Resources (DIR), is seeking a skilled ETL Analyst/Engineer to support the development and enhancement of a comprehensive data integration hub.
This position focuses on automation, complex SQL development, and Informatica-based ETL processing for a high-impact performance management and analytics system. You’ll be part of a fast-paced Agile team contributing to services that matter.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze business goals and operational procedures to identify data processing solutions
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and define data and reporting requirements
Write detailed technical documentation and system specifications
Review systems capabilities and propose optimized solutions within constraints
Develop ETL mappings and workflows using Informatica IICS, IDMC, or PowerCenter
Acquire and integrate data from various sources including Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server, Excel, Access, PDF
Write optimized and scalable SQL scripts for complex transformations
Support the agile SDLC lifecycle including backlog grooming, sprint planning, testing, deployment, and documentation
Create automated testing scripts using Python and other frameworks
Support Tableau dashboard pipelines through proper data transformations and validations
Maintain and enhance Java-based web applications that publish analytics dashboards
Participate in solution design, sprint ceremonies, and performance monitoring
Project Focus
Configuration and implementation of a centralized Data Integration Hub
Automation of data acquisition pipelines and transformation into a dimensional data model
Performance metric validation, agile delivery, and ongoing enhancements
Development and deployment of internal/external Tableau dashboards
Minimum Qualifications
8+ years of experience with Informatica IICS/IDMC/PowerCenter for ETL process automation
8+ years of data integration experience across various technologies and sources
Proficiency in writing complex, optimized SQL scripts
Strong analytical background working on analytics, performance, or warehousing platforms
Strong technical documentation skills including use of Visio, Erwin, MS Office, and MS Project
Python scripting for data testing/automation
Proven QA and defect tracking throughout full development lifecycle
Deep understanding of data validation, quality assurance, and test automation frameworks
Preferred Skills
Experience contributing to or building AI-enhanced test automation frameworks
Hands-on exposure to observability and testing infrastructure at scale
Past work on AI platforms or validation of AI-integrated solutions
Innovation in testing strategy or automation processes

Job Type: Fixed-Term Contract (6/12 Months – Extendable)

Experience: 5+ Years

Industry: IT / Data & Analytics / BFSI Domain

About The Role

We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer with proven expertise in Informatica and Snowflake to join a high-impact project in the banking and financial services domain. This fixed-term onshore opportunity is ideal for professionals with strong data integration, ETL development, and cloud data warehousing experience.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain robust ETL pipelines using Informatica PowerCenter.
Implement and manage data solutions using Snowflake for cloud data warehousing.

description:
As an Informatica MDM Specialist, you will manage and coordinate the implementation of a single source of truth for master data using Informatica, as well as oversee replications in target systems (with IT support).

You will also implement and support master data workflows, including setting up data validation rules and managing user assignments, ensuring data synchronization across all source and target systems.

Responsibilities
Contribute to the implementation and support the master data hub (golden records repository) in Informatica and its interfaces to target SAP systems
Contribute to implement and manage the master data workflows required, including the approval flows and the user assignments, as well as the SLA and KPI’s dashboards related to the MD workflows.
Provide MD workflow second level support and administration
Work with the MD Process team to validate the workflow positions and validation rules
Contribute to the data quality framework in Informatica, including the data profiling and monitoring. Support business users and animate data steward community
Provide expertise to business users on how to solve current business issues with tools to be implemented
Interface with IT (Informatica installation and updates, connections, authorization, jobs scheduling, release management…)

Requirements
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Master Data Management for an international company
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Strong MD Workflow implementation experience with interface knowledge, preferably in Service Now and/or in Informatica including user role set up.
Strong SAP expertise, in particular regarding master data objects, MD fields mapping and SQL
Knowledge of data management tools and its practical application in an organization
Good communication and presentation skills

job_title: TOP! ***** ZUCCHETTI INFORMATICA ASSUME: Sr. Sales Manager Triveneto, IT System Integration (Padova) – RAL top (fisso + variabile + auto + formazione)
description:
L’OPPORTUNITÀ IN SINTESI
AZIENDA: Zucchetti Informatica (gruppo Zucchetti SPA)
SETTORE: IT system integration (hardware, software, servizi)
RUOLO: Sr. Sales Manager Triveneto
TEAM GESTITO: Filiale Padova (commerciali e tecnici)
RIPORTA A: CEO 
ASSUNZIONE: Immediata a tempo indeterminato (full-time)
RETRIBUZIONE: Top di mercato (fisso + variabile + auto + formazione)
SEDE: Padova + smart working + clienti Triveneto
COMPETENZE/REQUISITI INDISPENSABILI: IT System Integration, B2B sales, sales seniority, gestione team commerciali, domicilio in zona, lingua inglese

IL GRUPPO
Gruppo Zucchetti nasce 1978 grazie a Mino Zucchetti e conta oggi 9.000+ collaboratori, €2B+ fatturato, 185 sedi in Italia e presenza in 15 paesi esteri
L’AZIENDA
Zucchetti Informatica viene fondata da Mino Zucchetti nel 1989 per vendere, installare e gestire gli elaboratori necessari al software Zucchetti. L’azienda è oggi un partner tecnologico per la crescita digitale che accompagna imprese di qualunque dimensione ed enti pubblici in un percorso di innovazione, offrendo soluzioni per rispondere alle sfide di un mercato in evoluzione
Obiettivo: semplificare la tecnologia tramite un interlocutore capace di integrare competenze, consulenza e supporto. L’azienda costruisce soluzioni su misura che migliorano produttività e qualità del lavoro, grazie a team qualificati, processi certificati e un capillare team di supporto sul territorio
Offerta: servizi IT infrastrutturali (cloud, on-premise), soluzioni IT (Hybrid Multicloud, Networking, Digital Workplace, Cybersecurity, AI), servizi mission-critical H24, stampa gestita, collaboration
Prodotti e servizi: hardware (workplace, cloud, server, storage), software terze parti, servizi (anche erogati autonomamente: gestione sistemi informativi, cybersecurity)
Marchi principali: HPE, HP Inc, Commvault, IBM, Dell, Lenovo, NetApp, Microsoft, Pure Storage, VMware, Sophos
Fatturato: 1/3 Pubblica Amministrazione, 1/3 Enterprise (500+ dipendenti), 1/3 Piccole-Medie Imprese. I 700mila clienti Zucchetti ricevono un servizio completo a livello applicativo e sistemistico
Punti forti: brand riconosciuto e apprezzato, affidabilità, innovazione (il mantra del gruppo!) di prodotto, soluzione, modalità organizzativa ed erogazione servizi. Per le PMI, l’azienda è interlocutore unico per tutte le esigenze di digitalizzazione 
Numeri: fatturato 2024 €65M+ (forte crescita, in utile), 8 sedi o agenzie, 160 persone

IL RUOLO
Per potenziare il team e supportare la crescita del business, Zucchetti Informatica cerca un Sr. Sales Manager che sviluppi il business della filiale Triveneto, gestendo clienti e contratti in essere, e soprattutto acquisendo nuovo business e clienti
È questo un ruolo di livello elevato che richiede competenze e autonomia. La figura sarà riferimento della Direzione nello sviluppo commerciale della filiale e nella gestione e rendicontazione delle figure tecniche on-site

PERCHÉ COGLIERE QUESTA OPPORTUNITÀ
Per operare in un ruolo centrale in un’azienda di valore, storica, solida, di dimensioni rilevanti e in crescita 
Per lavorare per obiettivi e in buona autonomia
Per diventare colonna portante dell’azienda, lavorando a stretto contatto con i vertici 
Per incrementare le proprie competenze e acquisire certificazioni
Per confrontarsi con realtà e progetti di vario taglio: dalla PMI all’Enterprise
Per emergere e realizzarsi professionalmente ed economicamente, partecipare alla crescita aziendale, ampliare progressivamente competenze e responsabilità 
Per imparare sempre qualcosa di nuovo, confrontandosi con diverse realtà e toccando con mano il risultato del proprio lavoro
Per operare in un ruolo vario e con poca routine. Le problematiche sono sempre diverse e legate alle esigenze dei clienti e di un’azienda in crescita
Per operare in un ambiente dedito all’innovazione e che consente di sviluppare competenze trasversali

SEDE DI LAVORO
Padova Est (Via Navigazione Interna, nuova sede del gruppo Zucchetti in apertura a settembre) + smart working parziale + visite clienti e affiancamenti (Triveneto)

TEAM
La figura gestirà il team Triveneto riportando al CEO

PRINCIPALI COMPITI E RESPONSABILITÀ 
Formazione continua su soluzioni e tecnologie con acquisizione di certificazioni dei vendor
Conoscenza approfondita del portafoglio prodotti/servizi con capacità di presentare la soluzione e intrattenere un dialogo con le figure chiave del cliente 
Mappatura territorio, ricerca clienti in target, sviluppo e presidio clienti assegnati
Gestione team di filiale (commerciale e tecnico): onboarding, formazione, feedback, valutazione risorse, presenze, compiti, presidi, reporting, budget, incentivi, KPI (visite, offerte, ordini, fatturato)
Presidio clientela assegnata con responsabilità di un budget di vendita e margine, garantendo il raggiungimento degli obiettivi tramite la gestione ottimale delle risorse e la relazione con i clienti
Approccio consulenziale al ciclo di vendita (in collaborazione con i referenti del cliente, dell’azienda e dei vendor): gestione portafoglio clienti, generazione pipeline, qualificazione opportunità, pianificazione visite, presentazione soluzioni, cross-selling, up-selling, formulazione offerte, gare, forecasting, CRM, negoziazione ordini, affiancamento al team commerciale nella chiusura delle trattative
Costante follow-up su andamento progetti
Cooperazione con il team di delivery per l’implementazione delle soluzioni
Collaborazione con Amministrazione e Legal per la stesura di documenti commerciali (offerte, condizioni di fornitura)
Collaborazione allo sviluppo di iniziative marketing nell’area 
Contributo all’identificazione di nuovi servizi e soluzioni, valutando mercato/concorrenza e confrontandosi con la Direzione
Responsabilità e gestione delle problematiche del cliente (e delle relative opportunità) nella loro totalità

COMPETENZE, REQUISITI, ESPERIENZE 
Domicilio in zona; Conoscenza del territorio; Patente B
Studi in Informatica o Ingegneria o Fisica o Matematica o Economia o Marketing (o competenze equivalenti)
Buona conoscenza della lingua Inglese 
Significative esperienze di gestione di team commerciali B2B in ambito IT (prodotti e servizi); La provenienza dal canale reseller/VAR/System Integrator costituirà un plus
Ottima conoscenza delle principali tecnologie e soluzioni IT
Competenze su alcuni dei seguenti vendor (o comparabili; La presenza di certificazioni costituirà un plus): HPE, HP Inc, Commvault, IBM, Dell, Lenovo, NetApp, Microsoft, Pure Storage, VMware, Sophos
Capacità di proposizione di servizi di gestione IT; È gradita l’esperienza di vendita di servizi di locazione operativa
Buon utilizzo di strumenti informatici (Office, Excel, PowerPoint, CRM)

CARATTERISTICHE VINCENTI 
Forte interesse e attitudine a un ruolo 100% Sr. Sales Management IT che richiede competenze, passione per il proprio lavoro, dinamicità, approccio analitico e soprattutto capacità di impattare positivamente sul business aziendale 
Motivazione a portare un significativo contributo alla crescita aziendale
Curiosità e interesse verso le nuove tecnologie
Capacità di valorizzare la vendita di soluzioni e servizi rispetto alla mera vendita di prodotti
Desiderio di mettersi in gioco, specializzarsi e accrescere competenze e capacità; Attitudine all’apprendimento e al miglioramento costante
Approccio orientato al risultato, capacità di lavorare in modo organizzato e per obiettivi, praticità, affidabilità, accuratezza, metodicità, ottimale gestione del tempo 
Capacità di gestione di budget, organizzative, di autonomia, di prendere l'iniziativa a fronte di scadenze 
Capacità di pianificare attività a medio/lungo termine per raggiungere costantemente gli obiettivi 
Capacità di far emergere le esigenze latenti del cliente e proporre soluzioni, generando una relazione di valore e duratura 
Attitudine al lavoro in team, consapevolezza di lavorare per un obiettivo comune considerando la visione d’insieme aziendale e la soddisfazione del cliente come priorità
Capacità relazionali: approccio piacevole e positivo, comunicazione ed esposizione efficace, pensiero critico, ascolto attivo
Standing adeguato, leadership, capacità organizzative, di mentoring e gestione di team
Ambizione alla crescita personale e professionale
Etica, onestà, riservatezza

L’AZIENDA OFFRE 
Inserimento in un ruolo centrale in un’azienda di valore, storica, solida, di dimensioni rilevanti e in crescita 
Assunzione immediata a tempo indeterminato (full-time)
Retribuzione top di mercato (fisso + variabile + auto)
Percorso strutturato di inserimento in azienda (onboarding)
Formazione continua (anche su soft skill) + acquisizione certificazioni dei vendor
Flessibilità e autonomia di lavoro; Smart working
Responsabilità di territorio 
Opportunità di crescita (incremento del team e dell’area)

PER CANDIDARSI
LA RICERCA E SELEZIONE È CONDOTTA SENZA INTERMEDIAZIONE, DIRETTAMENTE ED ESCLUSIVAMENTE DALL’AZIENDA (con il supporto di PBS per digital e comunicazione)
Si invita a candidarsi tramite LinkedIn verificando di aver caricato in LinkedIn il CV (PDF) più AGGIORNATO 
Tutte le candidature verranno attentamente valutate. I candidati più interessanti verranno contattati entro 48 ore

Introduction

Hiring manager and Recruiter should collaborate to create the relevant verbiage.

Your Role And Responsibilities

A Data Engineer with expertise in Data Integration is responsible for designing and building solutions to transfer data from operational and external environments to the business intelligence environment. They utilize tools such as Informatica, Ab Initio software, and DataStage (formerly Ascential) - IBM's WebSphere Data Integration Suite. This role involves creating and implementing Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes, ensuring the seamless flow of data throughout the business intelligence solution's lifecycle.

Preferred Education

Bachelor's Degree

Required Technical And Professional Expertise

Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience)..

At least 4 years of working experience in cloud operations, managing cloud-based infrastructure, and deploying cloud services..

Proficiency in cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Microsoft Azure..

Strong understanding of infrastructure-as-code principles and tools..

Familiarity with scripting and automation using languages like Python, PowerShell, Bash, etc..

Experience with monitoring and log aggregation tools for proactive issue detection..

Knowledge of security best practices and experience implementing security controls in cloud environments..

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.

job_title: Sr. Data Engineer (Informatica IDMC & Data Governance).
description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer with strong experience in enterprise data sourcing and data management projects, leveraging Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) and related tools. The ideal candidate will work on designing, developing, and optimizing data pipelines that support data integration, transformation, quality, and governance across hybrid environments (on-premises and cloud).

Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement data ingestion, transformation, and integration workflows using Informatica IDMC.
Develop and maintain scalable, efficient data pipelines that ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity.
Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to support data quality initiatives.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Support metadata management, cataloging, and lineage tracking using Informatica tools.
Implement data governance and privacy rules to comply with organizational and regulatory standards.
Troubleshoot and optimize workflows, orchestrations, and performance issues.
Work across hybrid architectures, integrating both on-premises and cloud-based systems.
Document technical designs, data flows, mappings, and processes for transparency and maintainability.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
5+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or ETL development using Informatica.
Strong working knowledge of Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform or Informatica Cloud Services.

Experience with key IDMC capabilities such as:
Data integration and transformation
Data quality and profiling
Metadata management and cataloging
Data pipeline orchestration
Governance and privacy controls
Familiarity with hybrid data environments (on-prem + cloud).
Solid understanding of data warehousing, data lakes, and data modeling concepts.
Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational and non-relational databases.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Informatica PowerCenter, IICS, Axon, or MDM is a plus.
Exposure to Agile/Scrum methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate across functional teams.
skills: ['Data Engineering', 'ETL Development', 'Informatica IDMC', 'Data Integration', 'Data Transformation', 'Data Quality', 'Data Profiling', 'Metadata Management', 'Data Pipeline Orchestration', 'Governance', 'Privacy Controls', 'SQL', 'Data Warehousing', 'Data Lakes', 'Data Modeling', 'Agile', 'DevOps']

description:
Hays IT Contracting is a cooperation based on B2B rules. We connect IT specialists with the most interesting, technological projects on the market.

Join the group of 500 satisfied Contractors working for Hays’ clients!
For our Client we are currently looking for Candidates for the position of:

📍 Location: Warsaw, Poland (Hybrid – 3 days onsite, possibly 2)
🏦 Industry: Banking
🕒 Availability: ASAP (latest start date: August 1st)
💰 Rate: 280 PLN/hour (negotiable based on experience and skills)

About the Role
We are seeking an experienced Informatica IDMC Administrator to manage and maintain our Informatica Data Management Cloud (IDMC) environment. This role is critical to ensuring the platform's high availability, performance, and security, while supporting strategic data integration and governance initiatives.

Key Responsibilities
Configure and maintain secure connections to both cloud and on-premises data sources and targets.
Deploy, schedule, and monitor data integration jobs, workflows, and taskflows.
Troubleshoot job failures, performance bottlenecks, and integration issues.
Implement and enforce data security policies (encryption, masking, access control).
Maintain metadata and data lineage using Informatica Cloud Data Governance and Catalog (CDGC).
Support CI/CD processes using tools like Git and Azure DevOps.
Automate administrative tasks using scripts or IDMC’s built-in automation features.
Collaborate with data engineers and architects to support data quality and integration efforts.

Requirements
✅ Must-Have Expertise In:
Cloud Data Integration (CDI)
Cloud Application Integration (CAI)
Informatica Data Quality (IDQ)
Cloud Data Governance and Catalog (CDGC)

✅ Additional Skills:
Experience scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting IDMC jobs and taskflows.
Strong understanding of data security best practices.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Knowledge of API integration and web services (REST/SOAP).
Ability to generate audit and usage reports using monitoring tools.
If you're ready to take on a strategic role in a dynamic banking environment and meet the above criteria, we’d love to hear from you!

What will the recruitment process look like:
Your CV will be verified by a Hays Recruiter
Recruiter will contact you by phone – a 15-minute conversation about the project and your experience
Technical conversation with the client – online meeting (1h)
Offer
Welcome to the project!
Hays Poland sp. z o.o. is an employment agency registered in a registry kept by the Marshal of the Mazowieckie Voivodeship under the number 361.

Develop new ETL and enhancements and modify existing code using Informatica PowerCenter.
Work independently to develop, configure, and unit test programs from specs (source to target mappings).
10+ years of hands-on experience in ETL development for a data warehouse.
10+ years of hands-on experience in development, maintenance, and enhancements of Informatica Mappings, Workflows, and processes.
8+ years of leadership experience, includes the management and coordination of an Informatica team.
Has experience working with complex SQL.
Expertise with integration technologies and processes.
Has Query Surge experience.
Candidate has window environment experience.
Possess knowledge of testing tools and techniques.
Has a working knowledge of Kimball design methodology.

Perform Data analysis, collect business requirements and identify business rules.

Recent experience and clear responsibilities in an ETL / Extracts / Data Engineering developer capacity.

3 or more years of experience in RDBMS / Data Warehousing platforms on Oracle.

Strong SQL knowledge and ability to write most complex queries.

Domain experience in Healthcare. 
Data profiling and implementation of automated solutions for data quality checks.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field of study

job_title: Sr Azure Data engineer with Informatica & teradata
description:
Company Description
Cliff IT Solutions is a leading provider of Identity Management and Security governance solutions for onsite and cloud applications. Our services help organizations reduce risk and maximize profitability through end-to-end integration of enterprise Identity access management products and cloud-based applications. We focus on delivering high-quality products from initiation through execution, supported by our expertise in cutting-edge technologies. At Cliff IT, teamwork and collaboration are at the heart of our operations, fostering strong partnerships with stakeholders and clients. We are dedicated to helping our clients improve information systems and application security while staying connected to the ever-changing market landscape.

Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Sr. Azure Data Engineer with Informatica & Teradata expertise, located in the Greater Minneapolis-St. Paul Area. The Sr. Azure Data Engineer will be responsible for designing and implementing data engineering solutions, including data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. Day-to-day tasks include building and maintaining data pipelines, performing data analytics, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to support business intelligence activities.

Qualifications
Strong Data Engineering and Data Modeling skills
Proficiency in Extract Transform Load (ETL) processes and Data Warehousing
Experience in Data Analytics and generating actionable insights
Familiarity with cloud-based solutions, particularly Azure
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Experience with Informatica and Teradata is highly desirable
Strong collaboration and communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
[4+] years of hands-on experience as a Teradata Developer with strong SQL proficiency.
[4+] years of extensive experience with Informatica PowerCenter (versions [9.x, 10.x]) including Designer, Workflow Manager, Workflow Monitor, and Repository Manager.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, Kimball methodology, and dimensional modeling (Star Schema, Snowflake Schema).
Expertise in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, functions, and views in Teradata.
Experience with Teradata utilities such as BTEQ, FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPT (Teradata Parallel Transporter), and FastExport.
Proven ability to design and implement efficient and scalable ETL solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Shell Scripting, Python) for automation.
Experience with cloud platform Azure and data warehousing in the cloud.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and reporting concepts.
Experience in an Agile/Scrum development environment.

Req ID: 328350

NTT DATA strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Senior Informatica ETL Developer - Remote to join our team in Toronto, Ontario (CA-ON), Canada (CA).

Job Overview

Perform Data analysis, collect business requirements and identify business rules. 
Analyze, develop and support Data Integration, EDW and Data Management using Informatica, SQL, Oracle etc. platforms and tools. 
Collaborate with data modelling team to define data integration logic. 
Create data mappings necessary to fulfill the requirements. 
Build and test new ETL programs to fulfill the service requests. 
Automate the ETL processes and pipelines using scripting and Schedulers. 
Participate in Unit Testing, assist QA team in Integration Testing, and support Business team for UAT. 
Participate in code deployment and coordinate with different infrastructure teams during go-live, post-production, and continued support of end product. 
Debug data quality issues by analyzing the upstream sources and provide guidance to data integration team resolutions. 
Work closely work with DBAs to fix performance bottlenecks. 

Skills

Recent experience and clear responsibilities in an ETL / Extracts / Data Engineering developer capacity. 
6 plus years of experience in data integration (ETL) with 5 or more in solution development using Informatica suite. 
4 or more years of experience in RDBMS / Data Warehousing platforms on Oracle. 
Must be an expert in Linux shell scripting to introduce automation as part of solution delivery. 
Strong SQL knowledge and ability to write most complex queries. 
Conceptual understanding of logical and physical data modelling is a must, and a working experience is a plus. 
Ability to develop and maintain data integration/ETL specifications that states integration rules and mappings. 
Ability to use documentation tools such as MS Visio and MS PowerPoint to diagram integration data flows. 
Ability to communicate effectively with business and technical staff members. 

Desired Skills

Certifications in ETL and Data Warehouse platforms. 
Domain experience in Healthcare. 
Data profiling and implementation of automated solutions for data quality checks. 

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field of study

About NTT DATA

NTT DATA is a $30 billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. We are one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is a part of NTT Group, which invests over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. job_title: Senior Data Engineer (Informatica IDMC & Data Governance).
description:
Job Summary:
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineer with strong experience in enterprise data sourcing and data management projects, leveraging Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) and related tools. The ideal candidate will work on designing, developing, and optimizing data pipelines that support data integration, transformation, quality, and governance across hybrid environments (on-premises and cloud).

Key Responsibilities:
Design and implement data ingestion, transformation, and integration workflows using Informatica IDMC.
Develop and maintain scalable, efficient data pipelines that ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity.
Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to support data quality initiatives.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Support metadata management, cataloging, and lineage tracking using Informatica tools.
Implement data governance and privacy rules to comply with organizational and regulatory standards.
Troubleshoot and optimize workflows, orchestrations, and performance issues.
Work across hybrid architectures, integrating both on-premises and cloud-based systems.
Document technical designs, data flows, mappings, and processes for transparency and maintainability.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
5+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering or ETL development using Informatica.
Strong working knowledge of Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform or Informatica Cloud Services.

Experience with key IDMC capabilities such as:
Data integration and transformation
Data quality and profiling
Metadata management and cataloging
Data pipeline orchestration
Governance and privacy controls
Familiarity with hybrid data environments (on-prem + cloud).
Solid understanding of data warehousing, data lakes, and data modeling concepts.
Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational and non-relational databases.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Informatica PowerCenter, IICS, Axon, or MDM is a plus.
Exposure to Agile/Scrum methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate across functional teams.

description:
Sobre nós

O Magalu é uma das maiores empresas de varejo do Brasil, reconhecida por sua inovação e presença digital. Com mais de 60 anos de história, conecta milhões de clientes por meio das lojas e de uma plataforma multicanal, oferecendo produtos e serviços de qualidade. A empresa investe continuamente em transformação digital, tecnologia e diversidade, criando um ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo.

Descrição do Cargo

Ponto focal nos processos operacionais; Controle de verbas contratuais, rebates e atualização dos relatórios da área;
Cadastro de novos produtos e integração de novos fornecedores; 
Acompanhamento do sell in e sell out dos produtos;
Responsável pelo acompanhamento do processo de compras, ciclo de vida do produto e distribuição entre 20 CDs; Gerenciamento da tabela de custos do sortimento;
Análises dos principais indicadores: venda, margem, market share, rupturas, visitas e conversão;
Contato com os canais parceiros: B2B, afiliados, CRM, ADS para campanhas promocionais;
Acompanhamento e elaboração dos planos de mídia para que tudo aconteça dentro do planejado;
Análise de mercado (preço, frete, prazo de entrega) com olhar atento aos concorrentes;
Gestão da vitrine e exposição de produtos no site e app Magalu.

Precisamos Que Você Já Tenha

Superior completo.
Excel Intermediário.
Experiência com comercial

Benefícios que oferecemos

VR/VA, Vale Transporte, Assistência Médica e Odontológica e Auxílio Creche.
Wellhub para bem-estar e saúde.
Bolsa de estudo com até 50% de desconto.
Descontos especiais nas empresas do Grupo Magalu (Magalu,Netshoes, Época Cosméticos, Estante Virtual, Kabum entre outras).
Cheque mãe benefício exclusivo para mães com filhos de até 10 anos e 11 meses.
Cheque Educação especial benefício exclusivo para mães e pais que possuam filhos com deficiência.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos o modelo híbrido de trabalho, que une a flexibilidade do trabalho remoto à interação presencial no escritório, oferecendo um equilíbrio entre as diferentes formas de colaboração e bem-estar.

Se você busca um ambiente de crescimento e desafios, Vem ser feliz!

Nossos valores nos unem e nossas diferenças nos potencializam como um grupo. Mais do que igualdade, buscamos equidade: Aqui, temos espaço para sermos autênticos, independentemente de gênero, etnia, raça, orientação sexual, clero ou deficiência.

Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Toyota.

Overview

Who we are

Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.

An important part of the Toyota family is Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the finance and insurance brand for Toyota and Lexus in North America. While TFS is a separate business entity, it is an essential part of this world-changing company- delivering on Toyota's vision to move people beyond what's possible. At TFS, you will help create best-in-class customer experience in an innovative, collaborative environment.

To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

This position is based at the Toyota Headquarters in Plano, TX

Who We’re Looking For

Toyota’s TFS Data and Technology organization is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Data Quality Analyst. The Data Quality Analyst will serve as a subject matter expert on Data Quality, metadata management and as an enterprise advocate for Enterprise Data Governance standards and policies.

What You’ll Be Doing

Own design, develop and deliver Data Quality, Data Profile and metadata best practices for the enterprise and promote their adoption via data literacy campaigns 
Serve as a subject matter expert on Data Quality, metadata management, Data Sharing and as an enterprise advocate for Enterprise Data Management standards and policies. 
Identify areas for data quality improvements and help to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies. 
Serve as the enterprise liaison between Business and technology to manage business definitions, data lineage (business and metadata), data taxonomies, ontology, and data quality rule definitions in a clearly defined and discoverable manner. 
Support and train Enterprise Data Stewards to use standard data management tools within the guidelines of governance policies and standards. Support Data Stewards in data management efforts that directly contribute towards major enterprise initiatives.Create and manage metadata and data quality metrics for each business unit. 
Drive alignment on data definitions, policies, governance, and enforcement of enterprise business rules for master data. 
Collaborate with the scrum team to translate business requirements into the product roadmap, EPICs, and sprint backlog. 

Qualifications Section

What You Bring

Bachelor's Degree 
Strong IT development/programming/coding professional work experience 
In depth understanding of Data Management technology landscape including technology landscape, standards, and best practices prevalent in data governance, data management, data quality, and data privacy. 
Working experience with data governance development tools 
Familiarity with data management principles and practices in DMBOK. 
Experience in creating and documenting policies and procedures. 
Strong listening, written, and verbal communication skills can exercise independent judgment and collaboratively bring issues to a successful conclusion. 
Strong experimental mindset to drive innovation amidst uncertainty and solving problems. Strong experience in process improvements, hands-on operational management, and change management. 
Working experience in agile work environment and good understanding of agile principles 

Added Bonus If You Have

Experience with CDCG, IDQ, CDQ 
Experience with data modeling. 
Knowledge of Tableau and ad-hoc reporting using analytic tools. 

What We’ll Bring

During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:

A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect 
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement 
Team Member Vehicle Purchase Discount 
Toyota Team Member Lease Vehicle Program (if applicable) 
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family 
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute 
Paid holidays and paid time off 
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools and more 
Tax Advantages Accounts (Health Savings Account, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA) 
Relocation assistance (if applicable) 

Belonging at Toyota

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace all perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong.

Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Have a question, need assistance with your application or do you require any special accommodations? Please send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com .

job_title: SQL Server Developer with SSIS and Informatica Expertise, New York | USA
description:
Company Description
SAZ System is your trusted partner for innovative IT solutions and software development. Our mission is to empower businesses with technology in today's digital landscape. We specialize in IT solutions, software development, consulting services, and digital transformation to help businesses thrive. With a proven track record, a customer-centric approach, and a talented team, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to clients globally.
Role Description
This is an on-site contract role for a SQL Server Developer with SSIS and Informatica expertise, based in Syracuse, NY. The SQL Server Developer will be responsible for database development, ETL processes, and data modeling. The role involves designing, developing, and maintaining database systems to support business applications and analytics. The developer will also collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and efficiency.
Qualifications
Database Development and Database Design skills
Extract Transform Load (ETL) skills and experience
Data Modeling and Analytical skills
Familiarity with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and Informatica
Strong problem-solving abilities
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
Experience in the IT industry is a plus

description:
Informatica ETL Developer

Industry: Enterprise Data Management – Banking, Financial Services & Insurance (BFSI).

We are a fast-growing technology consultancy delivering end-to-end data integration, analytics, and digital transformation solutions for Fortune 500 clients. Joining our onsite engineering team in India, you will play a pivotal role in building high-performance ETL pipelines that power real-time business intelligence and regulatory reporting.

Role & Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy Informatica PowerCenter mappings, sessions, and workflows for large-scale data warehouses.
Optimize ETL performance through partitioning, push-down, and advanced transformation techniques, achieving sub-second SLAs.
Collaborate with data modelers and business analysts to translate complex data mapping requirements into scalable solutions.
Implement data quality, lineage, and metadata management processes ensuring 99.9% accuracy and audit readiness.
Troubleshoot production issues, conduct root-cause analysis, and drive permanent fixes within aggressive timelines.
Document technical artifacts and mentor junior developers on Informatica best practices and SDLC standards.

Skills & Qualifications

Must-Have: 4+ years hands-on Informatica PowerCenter; strong SQL & PL/SQL; expertise in data warehousing concepts; Unix shell scripting; performance tuning and debugging.
Preferred: Experience with Informatica Cloud/IICS, Oracle Exadata or Snowflake, Agile delivery, and exposure to scheduling tools like Control-M.

Benefits & Culture

Greenfield projects with latest Informatica and cloud data stack.
Merit-based growth path and sponsored certifications.
Collaborative, high-ownership culture that values continuous learning.

Strong SQL knowledge and ability to write most complex queries. 
Conceptual understanding of logical and physical data modelling is a must, and a working experience is a plus. 
Ability to develop and maintain data integration/ETL specifications that states integration rules and mappings. 
Ability to use documentation tools such as MS Visio and MS PowerPoint to diagram integration data flows. 
Ability to communicate effectively with business and technical staff members. 

Desired Skills

Certifications in ETL and Data Warehouse platforms. 
Domain experience in Healthcare. 
Data profiling and implementation of automated solutions for data quality checks. 

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field of study

Everest DX We are a Digital Platform Services company, headquartered in Stamford.

Our Platform/Solution includes Orchestration, Intelligent operations with BOTs, AI-powered analytics for Enterprise IT.

Our vision is to enable Digital Transformation for enterprises to deliver seamless customer experience, business efficiency and actionable insights through an integrated set of futuristic digital technologies.

Digital Transformation Services Specialized in Design, Build, Develop, Integrate, and Manage cloud solutions and modernize Data centers, build a Cloud-native application and migrate existing applications into secure, multi-cloud environments to support digital transformation. Our Digital Platform Services enable organizations to reduce IT resource requirements and improve productivity, in addition to lowering costs and speeding digital transformation.

Digital Platform Cloud Intelligent Management (CiM) An Autonomous Hybrid Cloud Management Platform that works across multi-cloud environments. helps enterprise Digital Transformation get most out of the cloud strategy while reducing Cost, Risk and Speed.

Candidate should hands-on experience on ETL and SQL.
